During the history of poetry, the sun was connected with many concepts and had many names. Many of which are ethymologically connected:

Naturally the sun is associated with southern summer hours, days, years and shining light (similar to moon candles)
𓇶 Sun 三 𓋴𓌈𓇶 shine 𓋴𓌌𓇳 ⇔ 𓋴𓈙𓊪𓇳 سپید sapêd/saphir 𓁽 causative

𓈙 𓈗 𓇳 | summer | ShaMarRa 𒌓 Shamash ☑

𓆄 𓅱 𓇋 𓇋 𓏏 𓇳 | shadow, shade | shuid / shade ☑
𓆄 𓅱 𓇳 | sun, sunlight | shuin / sun ray + / shine

The honorary conventions to add 𓇳 behind the name was not recorded by Greeks:

𓊽 ˢtojdh in 𓇳𓊽𓆑 Ῥατοίσης Rá-toises Rhatoisēs Radjedef 𓇳𓊽𓆑 Djed-f-re Djedefre (modern)
